text: The Amelia Island Museum of History is located at 233 South Third Street, Fernandina Beach, Florida. It houses exhibits focusing on the history of Nassau County, Florida and is situated inside the old Nassau county jail. The building was added to the National Register of Historic Places on November 18, 2009. ==Photos== File:Amelia Island Museum of History corner, FL, US.jpg|Corner view File:Amelia Island Museum of History jail door, FL, US.jpg|Secure jail door File:Amelia Island Museum of History sign, FL, US.jpg|Sign File:Amelia Island Museum of History side door, FL, US.jpg|Side door ==Notes== ==External links== *Amelia Island Museum of History (official website) *Amelia Island Museum of History.
